actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to section 1 of H. Res. 1230. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 p.m. on December 5, 2022.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.

actions-list.header: Governing Board of the Office of Congressional Ethics
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 4(c) of House Resolution 8, 117th Congress, and the order of the House of January 4, 2021, the Speaker and the Republican Leader appointed Mr. William Paul Luther, Minnesota, for the remainder of the term of Ms. Karan English and Ms. Karan English, Arizona, alternate, for the remainder of the term as alternate of Mr. William Paul Luther.
The House received a communication from Karan L. English, Office of Congressional Ethics Board. Ms. English submitted her resignation from the Office of Congressional Ethics Board.

The House received a communication from William P. Luther, Board of the Office of Congressional Ethics. Mr. Luther submitted his resignation as an alternate on the Board of the Office of Congressional Ethics Board.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
The Chair recognized Mr. Scalise for the purpose of engaging in a colloquy with Mr. Hoyer on the expectations regarding the legislative schedule for the House during the upcoming week.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. H. Res. 1507 — "Providing for the printing of a revised edition of the Rules and Manual of the House of Representatives for the One Hundred Eighteenth Congress."
Mr. Hoyer asked unanimous consent to consider as introduced.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 390
actions-list.actionItem: 26 (Roll no. 500).
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 8876.
Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3372, H.R. 6878, H.R. 8876 and H.J. Res. 100. The resolution provides for adoption of H. Res. 1495 and H. Con. Res. 118.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1499. H.R. 8876 — "To reauthorize the Maternal, Infant, and Early Childhood Home Visiting program, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Takano to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal. Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Andre Carson to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
